article_title: Focus On Incentives, Not Budget Scores

article_metadata.description: New Mercatus research shows that the projected federal budgetary savings from the Affordable Care Act result from provisions that are unlikely to be economically or politically sustainable. These provisions include a new formula that reduces Medicare payments over time as well as a growing reach of several ACA taxes, including the Cadillac tax. In this piece, I analyze the effects of these "indexing provisions" and argue that policymakers should pay more attention to how policies impact incentives and less on the topline estimates produced by economic models.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
